page.title: 04The day of a farmer's son
page.content: It's the digital alarm that wakes me up on this Thursday morning, even though the Cockerel had woken up hours before now. Turning on my stereo I quickly roll back the quilt on my bed and open the door in the shower room and turned on the light in the room. It's then a quick trip downstairs to turn on the hot water, this is so that the water will heat up more quickly. This is about 7.30 am. And then it's eventually into the red hot shower for a freshen up. After the wash it's downstairs to breakfast. I need to hurry though to catch the private bus to Badger's Cross just up the road from us. This happens at roughly 8.00 am.I leave to catch the bus about ten minutes before the bus goes. This gives me time to get my bag packed and get myself and my bike out to Badger's Cross.
